summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The DVD_VideoAttributes structure describes the attributes of the video stream for the current title or menu.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fPanscanPermitted
member.summary: TRUE means the picture can be shown as pan-scan if the display aspect ratio is 4 x 3.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fLetterboxPermitted
member.summary: TRUE means the picture can be shown as letterbox if the display aspect ratio is 4 x 3.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.ulAspectX
member.summary: The video stream's X aspect (4 or 16).

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.ulAspectY
member.summary: The video stream's Y aspect (3 or 9).

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.ulFrameRate
member.summary: The frame rate in hertz (Hz), either 50 or 60.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.ulFrameHeight
member.summary: The frame height in lines (525 for a frame rate of 60 Hz or 625 for 50 Hz).

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.Compression
member.summary: Variable of type indicating the MPEG compression type used on the disc.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fLine21Field1InGOP
member.summary: TRUE means there is user data in line 21, field 1.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fLine21Field2InGOP
member.summary: TRUE means there is user data in line 21, field 2.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fIsSourceLetterboxed
member.summary: TRUE means the source video is in letterbox format. Subpictures and menu buttons can only be displayed in the active video area.

member.name: DVD_VideoAttributes.fIsFilmMode
member.summary: For 625/50 Hz systems, TRUE means "film mode" and FALSE means "camera mode."
